title: Nicola Sturgeon praises 'excellent' Lord Provost who spent £8,000 of public money on clothes and shoes
text:
Nicola Sturgeon has insisted Glasgow's Lord Provost is doing an "excellent" job despite the scandal over her charging the taxpayer £8,000 for clothes, shoes and beauty treatments.

The First Minister rejected calls for Eva Bolander, an SNP councillor, to resign and said her party colleague had "rightly reflected" that she should not have made some of the expense claims.

Ms Sturgeon also warned against creating a situation where only those who can afford to "equip themselves in the role" can be lord provosts, whom she said must attend "a lot of formal functions."
